title: CiderWaffles
author: CiderWaffles
created_time: August 20, 2022, 09:53:26 AMLast edit: August 20, 2022, 10:22:05 AM by CiderWaffles
content: I'm trying to create a new strategy for dice, and i was looking at the odds/numbers, and i was thinking.Can you roll 00.000 , or 100 ? But that's not my question.Then i set the slider to the lowest number, on 2 sites with a house edge of 1%, and the lowest number was 1.99, and highest was 98.So then i thought, if i set the slider to 1.99 and roll 1, that would be a .99% house edge, but .99 is 1% of 99.Why is the slider on one site (Wolfbet) labelled 1-100? Because if i set the slider to 98 and roll 99, then what does 100 have to do with anything?So, my question, how many numbers can you roll in dice? (ignoring the decimals? or not?). Now im watching Just-Dice and i see someone rolled 00.71 ... (please dont make the discussion about the sites i mentioned, they're just examples in the problem)

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: Quote from: CiderWaffles on August 20, 2022, 09:53:26 AMI'm trying to create a new strategy for dice, and i was looking at the odds/numbers, and i was thinking.Can you roll 00.000 , or 100 ? But that's not my question.Then i set the slider to the lowest number, on 2 sites with a house edge of 1%, and the lowest number was 1.99, and highest was 98.So then i thought, if i set the slider to 1.99 and roll 1, that would be a .99% house edge, but .99 is 1% of 99.Why is the slider on one site (Wolfbet) labelled 1-100? Because if i set the slider to 98 and roll 99, then what does 100 have to do with anything?So, my question, how many numbers can you roll in dice? (ignoring the decimals? or not?). Now im watching Just-Dice and i see someone rolled 00.71 ... (please dont make the discussion about the sites i mentioned, they're just examples in the problem)I am one of those who often play Dice games in various crypto gambling, and every time I play I don't go below 100 rolls and my bet amount depends on the crypto coin I want to bet in the game. For example, I chose dogecoin to play, so the minimum bet I will bet is 2 dogecoin in 100 roll or round game, if I use USDT, I will do 0.2usdt, that's the style I do in making my game in dice games on any crypto gambling platform currently.

comments.author: Doell
comments.body: Quote from: CiderWaffles on August 20, 2022, 09:53:26 AMSo, my question, how many numbers can you roll in dice? (ignoring the decimals? or not?). Now im watching Just-Dice and i see someone rolled 00.71 ... (please dont make the discussion about the sites i mentioned, they're just examples in the problem)I play dice depending on my profit target, if target has reached then I will stop playing, I always hit variety of odds e.g. x11- win chance 9.00 or even x112.5 - win chance 0.8800 But I don't stay on any those few, sometimes I hit more x2 - win  chance 49.50 too.Do you mean that's someone did a roll under on 00.71? if I'm not mistaken it's about x140. I think "somene at that's dice gambling site" you are referring maybe have targeted a chances as well. Like this thread Chasing a x330,000 - Update: i hit it! that person is too very smart.

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: Dice is my favourite and majority of my spending is now on Dice. In the past it was on sports betting. I used to prefer mostly x2, but when this doesn't work I prefer using the martingale strategy. Quite often used to try the roll over 99.99 looking for x9900. I've hit this when playing with zero betting amount.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on August 29, 2022, 12:50:40 PMDice is my favourite and majority of my spending is now on Dice. In the past it was on sports betting. I used to prefer mostly x2, but when this doesn't work I prefer using the martingale strategy. Quite often used to try the roll over 99.99 looking for x9900. I've hit this when playing with zero betting amount.That's hard to hit. I've done that before but never had the luck to hit with that multiplier and not lucky on that strategy that you've mentioned. Been there and so I have seen that it's not working for me, I just go with the normal one with a 98%.That's sort being assured but still with a 2% chance of losing. I just ignore the decimals and just slide the dice if I want to. But, I don't do automatic so I can fell my money winning or not.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: Mr. Magkaisa on August 29, 2022, 05:01:59 AMI am one of those who often play Dice games in various crypto gambling, and every time I play I don't go below 100 rolls and my bet amount depends on the crypto coin I want to bet in the game. For example, I chose dogecoin to play, so the minimum bet I will bet is 2 dogecoin in 100 roll or round game, if I use USDT, I will do 0.2usdt, that's the style I do in making my game in dice games on any crypto gambling platform currently.Merely reading what you explained here shows that you know what you are saying, this is what I like to read from gamblers, not from those who are gambling without any plan. It is a strategy within gambling that is uncertain itself, and that is what is needed to be productive. I just wanted to ask you, what are the sites you are using for the dice rolling and what are your experiences with withdrawals? I've read a lot of negative reviews from some common ones, please of a guide.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on August 29, 2022, 12:50:40 PMDice is my favourite and majority of my spending is now on Dice. In the past it was on sports betting. I used to prefer mostly x2, but when this doesn't work I prefer using the martingale strategy. Quite often used to try the roll over 99.99 looking for x9900. I've hit this when playing with zero betting amount.As for me, I still always prefer sport betting, especially the one I know most which is football betting, I prefer it because it offers the opportunity to analyze, but still it is a game of luck because anything can happen, a club you think would win may lose, and a club you think would lose may win. What I have known about virtual games like dice is that it is more of game of luck, I have seen the martingale strategy to be useful, by just starting to gamble with a very low amount of money, double the money or increase it in certain percentage as you continue to bet if losing, even if the bet does not hit in the first place is not bad at all as you double the money, so if the bet later hit then you have better profit, but I have preferred this strategy only on games that the profit : loss are both 50:50.

comments.author: wiss19
comments.body: Quote from: Doell on August 29, 2022, 10:25:51 AMQuote from: CiderWaffles on August 20, 2022, 09:53:26 AMSo, my question, how many numbers can you roll in dice? (ignoring the decimals? or not?). Now im watching Just-Dice and i see someone rolled 00.71 ... (please dont make the discussion about the sites i mentioned, they're just examples in the problem)I play dice depending on my profit target, if target has reached then I will stop playing, I always hit variety of odds e.g. x11- win chance 9.00 or even x112.5 - win chance 0.8800 But I don't stay on any those few, sometimes I hit more x2 - win  chance 49.50 too.Do you mean that's someone did a roll under on 00.71? if I'm not mistaken it's about x140. I think "somene at that's dice gambling site" you are referring maybe have targeted a chances as well. Like this thread Chasing a x330,000 - Update: i hit it! that person is too very smart.Obviously, you will hit lower multipliers than the higher ones because their win chance is high although there are rare occasions where you can easily hit higher multipliers. What you are doing is right. Don't stay hunting higher multi's for a long time but test only your luck for a few rolls and then play on your main targets which is lower multipliers.All gambling sites have a target chance or you can set your own desired multipliers but I think the op mean is that some gambler can set their odds lower than the minimum odds. I think that is only possible if you will use a dicing bot. The result will look like they roll on the lowest possible odds but they actually roll on the minimum odds only.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Quote from: romero121 on August 29, 2022, 12:50:40 PMDice is my favourite and majority of my spending is now on Dice. In the past it was on sports betting. I used to prefer mostly x2, but when this doesn't work I prefer using the martingale strategy. Quite often used to try the roll over 99.99 looking for x9900. I've hit this when playing with zero betting amount.This will take too long to hit, but you will eventually get there. If the platform allows you to bet a satoshi per roll then perhaps you can do an experiment similar to what seoincorporation did. It will take an awful amount of bets but this will hit eventually. At times, I'm also trying to hit the x9900 multiplier when I'm getting bored and I just want to get things over with while also taking a chance to see whether I'll get something good. This happens very rarely though as I try to get the most out of my money by staying at a over/under 49.5 roll most of the time.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on August 30, 2022, 07:18:03 AMQuote from: romero121 on August 29, 2022, 12:50:40 PMDice is my favourite and majority of my spending is now on Dice. In the past it was on sports betting. I used to prefer mostly x2, but when this doesn't work I prefer using the martingale strategy. Quite often used to try the roll over 99.99 looking for x9900. I've hit this when playing with zero betting amount.As for me, I still always prefer sport betting, especially the one I know most which is football betting, I prefer it because it offers the opportunity to analyze, but still it is a game of luck because anything can happen, a club you think would win may lose, and a club you think would lose may win. What I have known about virtual games like dice is that it is more of game of luck, I have seen the martingale strategy to be useful, by just starting to gamble with a very low amount of money, double the money or increase it in certain percentage as you continue to bet if losing, even if the bet does not hit in the first place is not bad at all as you double the money, so if the bet later hit then you have better profit, but I have preferred this strategy only on games that the profit : loss are both 50:50.Sports betting is for the scholars. Dice is for the lazy who don't like to read books. Both can be very profitable depending on the player.Martingale however is the biggest scam ever. It is not useful for anything. You are basically doubling down on your losses and with every round you risk more and more while your potential gains are going less and less.In the end, if the player has a good information about the teams/leagues he is wagering on, then he should bet on sports. If the player has no information at all, then his best chance is playing luck based games.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: Quote from: CiderWaffles on August 20, 2022, 09:53:26 AMSo, my question, how many numbers can you roll in dice? (ignoring the decimals? or not?). Back then there was a dice site where I could roll the dice and get 6 digits including the decimals. It's also possible to roll the same without decimals and extend the range to thousands as there was a dice site that did it so I think the numbers could go higher if needed.Quote from: CiderWaffles on August 20, 2022, 09:53:26 AMWhy is the slider on one site (Wolfbet) labelled 1-100? Because if i set the slider to 98 and roll 99, then what does 100 have to do with anything?It's probably because of how the slider has a fixed value per tick but still you can adjust it even further by increasing the multiplier.

comments.author: Wind_FURY

I've hit this when playing with zero betting amount.As for me, I still always prefer sport betting, especially the one I know most which is football betting, I prefer it because it offers the opportunity to analyze, but still it is a game of luck because anything can happen, a club you think would win may lose, and a club you think would lose may win. What I have known about virtual games like dice is that it is more of game of luck, I have seen the martingale strategy to be useful, by just starting to gamble with a very low amount of money, double the money or increase it in certain percentage as you continue to bet if losing, even if the bet does not hit in the first place is not bad at all as you double the money, so if the bet later hit then you have better profit, but I have preferred this strategy only on games that the profit : loss are both 50:50.Sports betting is for the scholars. Dice is for the lazy who don't like to read books. Both can be very profitable depending on the player.Martingale however is the biggest scam ever. It is not useful for anything. You are basically doubling down on your losses and with every round you risk more and more while your potential gains are going less and less.In the end, if the player has a good information about the teams/leagues he is wagering on, then he should bet on sports. If the player has no information at all, then his best chance is playing luck based games.The only form of gambling that can be "profitable" is the form of gambling that gives you the opportunity to bet/add money to the pot if the odds are in your favor, and the ability to decrease the money if they are not. I believe most of the dice games have a consistent house edge, which will make you mathematically the long term loser.OP, it's a odds chart from craps. I don't know if it can help,
